newsitem.title: UK: UK power watchdog sends N.Ireland Elec to MMC.
newsitem.headline: UK power watchdog sends N.Ireland Elec to MMC.

text.p: The Northern Irish deputy director general for electricity supply said on Friday he noted "with regret" Northern Ireland Electricity's rejection of his price proposals and was referring the matter to the Monopolies and Mergers Commission (MMC).

Charles Coulthard said that while he respected the company's right to reject his proposals for a one-off 31 percent price reduction from next year followed by a two percent cut in annual prices for four years, he was disappointed with the decision.

"When I had expected that NIE would be working with me to tackle the problem of Northern Ireland's high electricity costs they instead have chosen for the first time since privatisation to deliberately seek to increase the price which customers in Northern Ireland must pay for electricity," he said.
"I will refer the matter to the MMC immediately."
